question: What happens when alcohol is taken in excess?
option2: It produces inflammation of the stomach
option3: It causes the heart to become weak
explanation: AlcoholÂ at very high levels can hinder signals in the brain that control automatic responses such as the gag reflex. A person who drinks to the point of passing out is in danger of choking on his or her vomit and dying from a lack of oxygen. It destroys the liver. It produces inflammation of the stomach. It causes the heart to become weak.
